title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,956.95 USD/T on December 24, 2025, up 0.32% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 5.16%, and are up 15.51% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures reached $2,950 per tonne, near a three-year high amid supply concerns and China's efforts to prevent overcapacity.

title: Aluminium cash offer hits USD 2,932/t as LME momentum builds
summary: LME aluminium cash offers strengthened to USD 2,932 per tonne on December 24, up 0.54% from the prior session. The 3-month contract bid rose to USD 2,957 per tonne, with forward contracts also gaining. Alumina Platts prices edged down slightly to USD 310.22 per tonne.

title: Domestic and international liquidity easing supports aluminum prices hovering at highs [SMM Aluminum Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME aluminum closed at $2,956.5/mt on December 24 after hitting a high of $2,969.5/mt, supported by liquidity easing. SHFE aluminum futures fell 0.83% to 22,145 yuan/mt, while spot A00 aluminum surged to 22,030 yuan/mt. Secondary aluminum prices like ADC12 rose, with import windows reopening due to stronger domestic prices.

title: SMM review of alumina and aluminium production in November and forecast for December 2025
source: AL Circle (SMM review via AL Circle press release)
date: December 2025 (report covering November and forecast for December 2025)
summary: SMM reports that China's existing aluminium capacity stood at about 46.12 million tonnes at end-November 2025, with operating aluminium capacity around 44.225 million tonnes, and forecasts a slight month-on-month increase in operating aluminium capacity entering December 2025 as several new projects start pot commissioning. The report also notes metallurgical-grade alumina capacity of about 110.32 million tonnes and highlights import pressure on domestic alumina, possible voluntary production cuts, and scheduled maintenance affecting near-term operating rates.

title: BCA shares 2026 aluminium production outlook — a journey through ups and downs
source: AL Circle (summary of BCA Research commentary)
summary: BCA Research says Chinese primary aluminium production is close to its 45 million tonne ceiling under the 2025–2027 action plan, which supports near-term aluminium prices due to tight primary supply in China; rising secondary aluminium and overseas capacity may offset some domestic primary growth constraints. The piece highlights regional electricity cost differences as a key factor for how quickly production outside China can expand and notes substitution demand versus copper as a price-supporting factor.

title: Aluminum Rises to 3½-Year Highs as Mozal Smelter to Be Placed Under Care and Maintenance
summary: Trading Economics reports aluminium futures climbed toward multi-year highs after South32 announced its Mozal smelter in Mozambique will be placed under care and maintenance by March 2026, tightening global primary aluminium supply; the report also cites a potline suspension at Iceland’s Grundartangi and falling Japanese port inventories as market-supportive. The item notes China is expected to approach its 45 million tonne annual output cap, contributing to supply concerns and higher prices.

title: 2025 Aluminum Scrap Market Review: Tariffs, Fires, and a Challenging Year
summary: IndexBox reviews disruptions to North American secondary/aluminium-scrap-related capacity in 2025 — including fires at Novelis’s Oswego plant — that reduced domestic recycled aluminium consumption and shifted ingot casting patterns, impacting capacity and supply chains. The article discusses tariff effects, export demand for secondary grades, and forecasts capacity attrition and uncertainty for 2026 demand.

title: Mines Secretary's Clarion Call to Nalco: Boost Production NOW! Efficiency Drive Mandated Amid Expansion
summary: A commodity-sector report covers the Mines Secretary urging Nalco to increase aluminium production and improve efficiency amid planned expansions, indicating government-level pressure to raise output from an Indian producer. The piece frames the call as part of efforts to support domestic supply and planned capacity growth.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices rose to 3,088 CNY/T on December 25, 2025, up 0.10% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 0.10%, though still 5.31% lower year-over-year. On December 24, prices were at 3,087 CNY/T, up 0.42%, amid soft demand for ferrous metals.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 906 USD/T on December 24, 2025, down 0.22% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices rose 0.44% and are up 27.60% year-over-year. Recent news highlights HRC Steel hitting multi-week highs and lows earlier in 2025.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 25.12.2025
summary: SteelRadar provides real-time updates on global iron and steel exchanges, including Shanghai Futures Rebar prices as of December 24, 2025. Various futures terms for rebar and other steel products show flat performance at 0.00 change. Coverage includes indices, prices, and news for major markets.

title: US scrap trends outlook: December 2025
summary: US ferrous scrap market sentiment is neutral, with the Trend Indicator at 47.9, signaling a 1% price decline month-over-month. Sellers are mildly optimistic, buyers bearish, amid mill outages, weak steel pricing, and stagnant activity. No strong seasonal or macro push is evident.

title: Effective Tariff Rates and Revenues (Updated December 23, 2025)
summary: Steel and aluminum products face the highest effective US tariff rates at 40%, due to Section 232 tariffs and recent increases. Average effective tariff rate rose to 10.65% in September 2025. China faces the highest partner tariffs at 37.1%.

title: Indonesia's 304 stainless steel export offers rise sharply on Tsingshan price hike
summary: Indonesia's 304 stainless steel export prices rose sharply for the third week in December due to Tsingshan's price hike. Related updates include stainless HRC and round bar prices in China on December 25. Nickel and chrome ore markets also show activity.

title: Viewpoint: US steel tariffs cause scrap supply glut
summary: US steel tariffs under Trump have doubled, leading to stronger mill demand but causing a scrap supply glut. Sellers sought higher demand earlier in 2025, impacting scrap markets amid tariff effects.

title: MEPS’s global steel production and capacity round-up
summary: A December round-up of global steel production and capacity changes, highlighting ArcelorMittal site upgrades in Europe, new stainless steel facilities in China and capacity adjustments including workforce reductions and crude steel shipment cuts at a major integrated plant. The report also notes modernisation at plants (improving silicon-steel quality) and smaller capacity expansions such as a stainless cold-rolling upgrade in Guangdong, China.

title: US raw steel production is down 1.4 percent - week 49, 2025
summary: SteelOrbis reports AISI weekly US raw steel production at about 1.736 million net tons for the week ending 29 November 2025, a 1.4% decline from the prior week and a year-on-year rise of roughly 7.7%. The article includes adjusted year-to-date production through 29 November 2025 and capacity-utilisation figures for the US steel industry.

title: Industry Data - Weekly Raw Steel Production (AISI)
summary: AISI’s weekly industry data shows US domestic raw steel production of 1,725,000 net tons in the week ending 20 December 2025 with a capability utilisation rate of 75.3%. The AISI release provides regional breakdowns, year-to-date adjusted totals and notes the estimates are compiled from partial reporting and monthly updates.

title: US weekly steel production grows in most regions
summary: Argus reports weekly US steel output rose in most regions for the week of 13 December 2025, with total production near 1.75 million short tons and commentary on regional divergences—Great Lakes declines versus gains elsewhere—and broader market context including import flows and price pressures.

title: Chinese steel imports put Latin America's industry under strain
summary: EFE reports that rising Chinese steel exports are pressuring Latin American steelmakers, citing data that China produced over 1 billion tonnes of crude steel in 2024 and analyses suggesting large global excess capacity available for export. The article references forecasts that China’s investments could expand excess capacity significantly by 2027, exacerbating import pressures on regional producers.

title: Viewpoint: US steel tariffs cause scrap supply glut
summary: An Argus viewpoint piece argues that changes in US trade policy and tariffs have altered scrap flows and domestic mill behaviour, contributing to a glut of ferrous scrap and affecting production economics and capacity decisions at mills. The article discusses implications for steel production, pricing divergence with international markets and expected gradual production adjustments into fiscal 2026.

title: ArcelorMittal resumes steel production at its plant in Fos-sur-Mer
summary: GMK Center reports that ArcelorMittal restarted steel production at its Fos-sur-Mer site in France after an October fire that previously halted operations, signalling restoration of capacity at the affected integrated facility. The article outlines the status of repairs and the plant’s return to production.

title: Company uses solar ovens for 100% recycled steel production
summary: PANATERE inaugurated two solar furnaces in La Chaux-de-Fonds, Switzerland, capable of melting 100% recycled steel using concentrated solar energy without fossil fuels. This innovation produces fully recycled stainless steel and copper with a near-zero carbon footprint, reducing emissions by a factor of 165 compared to conventional processes. The project promotes circular economy and industrial sovereignty, with potential for replication in other countries.

title: Accelerating towards clean steel's positive tipping point
summary: The world is nearing a positive tipping point for clean steel decarbonization, driven by declining clean-tech costs, growing market demand from industries like automotive and construction, and supportive policies highlighted at COP30. Steel accounts for 7-8% of global carbon emissions, making its transformation critical for net-zero goals. International cooperation and standards for low-emission steel are accelerating investment and production shifts.

title: Reflecting on 2025: Circularity, Sustainability and Transformation for Steel Manufacturing
summary: As 2025 ends, New Zealand's steel sector advanced with the Electric Arc Furnace announcement at New Zealand Steel for lower-carbon production from recycled scrap, alongside developments in circular design and digital material passports for traceability. These initiatives achieved over 50% carbon emission reductions through design and material selection, with a new research centre underway to drive advanced manufacturing. Steel proved central to the circular economy amid rising demand for sustainable construction.

title: Copper hits US$12000 for first time as tariff trade upends market
summary: Copper prices hit a record above US$12,000 a ton due to mine outages, including flooding at the Kamoa-Kakula complex in the Democratic Republic of Congo, and trade disruptions from U.S. tariffs. Analysts from Morgan Stanley warn of a major global copper deficit next year exceeding 600,000 tons, driven by demand from electric vehicles, renewables, and AI. Citigroup forecasts prices could reach US$15,000 in a bull-case scenario.

title: Copper hits record high as robust US GDP data boosts demand prospects
summary: Copper prices extended gains to hit all-time highs, supported by robust U.S. GDP data enhancing demand prospects. The rally reflects ongoing market strength amid broader commodity trends.

title: Coppers Tightest Moment Yet: Record Prices Growing Deficits and a Rush to Secure Supply
summary: The copper market faces its tightest period with record prices and growing deficits, as mine supply is expected to be weakest in Q4 2025 and Q1 2026. This signals entry into a clear deficit phase amid supply challenges.

title: Weekly Market Recap (December 25) –Copper 2025
summary: Copper prices surged to unprecedented highs this week, concluding a year of supply shocks and trade realignments. The recap highlights key market shocks, mergers, and megatrends impacting copper in 2025.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel rose to 15,660 USD/T on December 24, 2025, up 0.13% from the previous day. Over the past month, nickel's price has risen 4.96%, and it is up 1.26% compared to the same time last year.

title: On December 25, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: On December 25, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was 123,400–131,400 yuan/mt, with an average price of 127,400 yuan/mt. This represents a decline of 2,800 yuan/mt from the previous day.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices experienced a significant correction on December 25...
summary: Nickel prices underwent a significant correction on December 25 amid a 400-billion-yuan MLF operation by the central bank. The SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 127,400 yuan/mt, down 2,800 yuan/mt from the prior session.

title: Bahlil confirms plans to cut nickel, coal output in 2026 to support prices
summary: Indonesia's Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia confirmed plans to reduce nickel ore production to 250 million tonnes in 2026, down from 379 million tonnes in 2025, to regulate supply and support prices. The move addresses declining nickel ore prices, with limonite at US$22.5/tonne and saprolite at US$51.9/tonne as of Dec 15. APNI expects price increases following the cuts and a revision to the nickel benchmark price formula.

title: Nickel price extends rebound after Indonesia signals mine output cut
summary: Nickel prices rose up to 1.5% on Friday following Indonesia's proposal to cut nickel ore production to 250 million tons in 2026 from 379 million tons this year, responding to a price slump. The reduction aims to counter oversupply amid Indonesia's dominant production. Analysts predict nickel will outperform other base metals in 2026 if cuts proceed.

title: Viewpoint: Indonesia's MHP surge to hit nickel prices
summary: Indonesia's mixed hydroxide precipitate (MHP) output is projected to reach 482,000 tonnes of nickel metal equivalent in 2025, a 50% rise from 2024, contributing to market oversupply. MHP capacity is forecast to nearly double to 862,000 t/yr in 2026 with new HPAL projects. This surge intensifies the nickel surplus, estimated at 212,000t in 2025 and 288,000t in 2026.

title: On December 25, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: The SMM #1 refined nickel price on December 25 averaged 127,400 yuan/mt, ranging from 123,400–131,400 yuan/mt, down 2,800 yuan/mt from the previous day. This reflects ongoing price pressures in the refined nickel market.

title: Copper Cables: Antitrust Launches Investigation into Alleged Cartel
summary: Italy's Antitrust Authority has initiated an investigation into major low-voltage copper cable manufacturers, including Prysmian Cavi e Sistemi Italia Srl and others, for alleged price-fixing since 2005. Inspections were conducted yesterday at company offices, supported by Guardia di Finanza. Prysmian shares dropped 1.26% in response, though analysts view the impact as negligible given the small market share.
